org.orgName: Third Judicaial Distrcit of Washington Territory

div1.p: In the District Court of . the Third Judical District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the application of Joseph Bowers for a Writs of Habeas Corpus

To the judges of said court. The petition of Joseph Bowers I Thnk your petitonres is unlawfully unpracied, detained and mastering of his lively by was co chance sheriff of this county, Washington Territory, in thee county of said count and the city of Seeattle. II Thank the court or presicutor of said impriosnment, detention, and restrained according to the best knowledge and belief of your petionioner, is that the said if the court holds your petion by virtual of an alleged commitment by M. Sodenberg a Justice of the peach in and for said County communicating
your petinoer to the County jail of said county upon a charge of assault and battery.

III That the said inprisonment, detiontion said restrined and illegal and the illegallity there of courts in this to with; I that our fee (dat of Nov. 1887), your petitioner was brought before said justice of the peace, N.Sedenbang, charged with assult and battery in said King County; that thereafter of the 2nd day of Nov. 1887. The said Jusice of the peaces and your petitioner guilty said crime and sentened him to pay a fine of one thousand dollars in costs, and to be committed to the jail of said county for the period of five hundred days in said fine and costs never was paid. II That the said justice had no jurasdiction to have said judgment againsts your petitioner. III Thank teh said Justice and his jurasdictionin convicting said judgment. IV Thank said alleged said judge much is voice.

Therefore your petitioner says that wait of habeas corpus to issue herein, dine to the Sheriff of said County accomodating said sheriff to produce the body of your petitioner before your hours at a time and place therein to be named together with said court, and the course of the deterntion of your petitioner. Joseph Bowers
Territory of Washington Couty of King
Jos. Bowers, beign first duty swore an oath says that he is the petitioner that he has heard the on going petition said rumoirs the courts theme of habus corpus the source to be this. Joseph Bowers
Subscribed and swarn to be heard was this day of Nov. 1887.

In . the matter of the application of Joseph Bowers for Habeas Corpus
Petiton
Office . of the Sheriff of Wash. County Washington Territory

S Dilliam Behau Sheriff of King County Dr. S do heriby certify that at the coming to me of the arrayed and of habeas Corpus the said Joesph Bowers was committed to my custody, and is detained by virtue of a commimant a copy of which is herited annual thee arrogance of which sals herwith producee. Wages the less I have the body of this said Joseph Bowers before the court and of home, day, and place as Sam iin said work commander. Dated as Seattle Dr. S this 16th day ofDec 1887
Dr. William Lonrhrome Sheriff of King Count Dr. T. By M. Gadder
